intro: Galium pseudoverum, commonly known as false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its stems are typically prostrate or ascending, and it often forms dense mats in moist, shaded environments. Galium pseudoverum is native to parts of Europe and is commonly found in woodlands and along stream banks.
